alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collier and north central Mainland Monroe Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Big Cypress National Preserve, or 19 miles northeast of Everglades City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Cypress National Preserve. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe
